causes.title: Causes of Air Pollution
content: Burning fossil fuels like coal, oil, and gas releases pollutants.
Industrial emissions contain harmful chemicals and particulate matter.
Deforestation reduces the ability to absorb carbon dioxide.
Agricultural activities release methane and ammonia gases.
Vehicle exhaust emits carbon monoxide and nitrogen oxides.

effects.title: Effects of Air Pollution
content: Respiratory diseases such as asthma and bronchitis.
Cardiovascular issues due to prolonged exposure.
Acid rain affects soil and water quality.
Global warming caused by increased greenhouse gases.
Harmful effects on wildlife and ecosystems.

solutions.title: Solutions to Reduce Air Pollution
content: Switch to renewable energy sources like solar and wind.
Implement strict emission control policies.
Promote public transportation and electric vehicles.
Encourage afforestation and reforestation programs.
Adopt sustainable agricultural practices.

global_statistics.title: Global Air Pollution Statistics
content: 9 out of 10 people worldwide breathe polluted air.
Air pollution causes approximately 7 million deaths annually.
Transportation contributes about 25% of global CO2 emissions.
Indoor air pollution is responsible for 3.8 million deaths yearly.
China, India, and the USA are the top three polluting countries.
